page.title: 10Entertainment.
page.content: {Our Community Hall. } LUCY CHAPMAN. Many activities take place in the Quarff Community Hall which was opened in 1926. In 1984 an extension was built which included a kitchen, bar and cloakrooms. It is used as a Youth Club two days in the week. Once a week there is a whist drive when a card game called 500 is played. Sometimes people have their birthday parties in the hall and wedding receptions. We have sales of work and occasionally a disco with coloured lights. Sometimes there are dances when a local group or band comes to play. During the Folk Festival there was a concert in the hall; folk singers came from the mainland and overseas. Last week a Childrens' Circus came to entertain us. All the acts were perfomed by teenagers. There were clowns, unicyclists and stiltwalkers.
